verses.verse: Whither is thy beloved <S%H1730><s%> gone <S%H1980><s%>, O thou fairest <S%H3303><s%> among women <S%H802><s%>? whither is thy beloved <S%H1730><s%> turned aside <S%H6437><s%>? that we may seek <S%H1245><s%> him with thee.

My beloved <S%H1730><s%> is gone down <S%H3381><s%> into his garden <S%H1588><s%>, to the beds <S%H6170><s%> of spices <S%H1314><s%>, to feed <S%H7462><s%> in the gardens <S%H1588><s%>, and to gather <S%H3950><s%> lilies <S%H7799><s%>.
I am my beloved's <S%H1730><s%>, and my beloved <S%H1730><s%> is mine: he feedeth <S%H7462><s%> among the lilies <S%H7799><s%>.
Thou art beautiful <S%H3303><s%>, O my love <S%H7474><s%>, as Tirzah <S%H8656><s%>, comely <S%H5000><s%> as Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%>, terrible <S%H366><s%> as an army with banners <S%H1713><s%>.

Turn away <S%H5437><s%> thine eyes <S%H5869><s%> from me, for they <S%H1992><s%> have overcome <S%H7292><s%> me: thy hair <S%H8181><s%> is as a flock <S%H5739><s%> of goats <S%H5795><s%> that appear <S%H1570><s%> from Gilead <S%H1568><s%>. overcome: or, puffed me up

Thy teeth <S%H8127><s%> are as a flock <S%H5739><s%> of sheep <S%H7353><s%> which go up <S%H5927><s%> from the washing <S%H7367><s%>, whereof every one beareth twins <S%H8382><s%>, and there is not one barren <S%H7909><s%> among them.
As a piece <S%H6400><s%> of a pomegranate <S%H7416><s%> are thy temples <S%H7541><s%> within <S%H1157><s%> thy locks <S%H6777><s%>.
There are threescore <S%H8346><s%> queens <S%H4436><s%>, and fourscore <S%H8084><s%> concubines <S%H6370><s%>, and virgins <S%H5959><s%> without number <S%H4557><s%>.

My dove <S%H3123><s%>, my undefiled <S%H8535><s%> is but one <S%H259><s%>; she is the only one <S%H259><s%> of her mother <S%H517><s%>, she is the choice <S%H1249><s%> one of her that bare <S%H3205><s%> her. The daughters <S%H1323><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> her, and blessed <S%H833><s%> her; yea, the queens <S%H4436><s%> and the concubines <S%H6370><s%>, and they praised <S%H1984><s%> her.

Who is she that looketh forth <S%H8259><s%> as the morning <S%H7837><s%>, fair <S%H3303><s%> as the moon <S%H3842><s%>, clear <S%H1249><s%> as the sun <S%H2535><s%>, and terrible <S%H366><s%> as an army with banners <S%H1713><s%>?

I went down <S%H3381><s%> into the garden <S%H1594><s%> of nuts <S%H93><s%> to see <S%H7200><s%> the fruits <S%H3><s%> of the valley <S%H5158><s%>, and to see <S%H7200><s%> whether the vine <S%H1612><s%> flourished <S%H6524><s%>, and the pomegranates <S%H7416><s%> budded <S%H5132><s%>.

Or ever I was aware <S%H3045><s%>, my soul <S%H5315><s%> made <S%H7760><s%> me like the chariots <S%H4818><s%> of Amminadib <S%H5993><s%>. Or ever: Heb. I knew not made: or, set me on the chariots of my willing people

Return <S%H7725><s%>, return <S%H7725><s%>, O Shulamite <S%H7759><s%>; return <S%H7725><s%>, return <S%H7725><s%>, that we may look <S%H2372><s%> upon thee. What will ye see <S%H2372><s%> in the Shulamite <S%H7759><s%>? As it were the company <S%H4246><s%> of two armies <S%H4264><s%>. of: or, of Mahanaim
